Zacks says WMT is the bull of the day. At least someone else thinks WMT is a good place to be besides me. WMT is THE place to shop for most everything. I would bet money if a survey was taken with RV'ers, they would say their favorite stopping place for any needed items would be WMT. WMT sells the most groceries, their parking lots are big to accommodate Rv's and they sell some needed RV items and they have gas stations at most of the WMT's. I am going RV'ing next week and I know I will be stopping at some in the areas I am going. The fridge in my RV is small and that necessitates planning ahead and making frequent stops. Plus if by chance someone can't get a campground, you can stay in a WMT parking lot in most locations (unless the city has an ordinance to protect the private campgrounds). However, I have yet to camp in a WMT lot, but it is on my bucket list just so I can say I did it.
The dividend will prob. show up tomorrow in brokerage accounts. At least it will in mine since Monday is a holiday and it is paid on Tue.

Is Walmart worth a buy a $139.I think we have to remember that the expected upper end earnings are 135 to 150 and the next years earnings growth is just about 7.39% more.Which is not bad, but the fact is that it is trading at a PE of 39 and not 9 is a wonder for this goliath.I say PE OF 9 because most companies with growth less than 8 % are dangerously priced in this current markets and historically they trade at PE below 10 or 12. So even if it goes down to the PE of 19, I fear I will have to take a big shaving. If you feel other wise and think that it is worth the risk please let me know. There is a lot of millennials enthusiasm right now and people saying that if the markets fall so what we will hold it for ever, but then when reality sets in we still have to test the prudence of this millennials. So far what I noticed is that when things do not go their way they easily leave even their parents and never return.

For anyone who doesn't know how free lunch in schools works, it is totally abused. All you do is look at a form that has the limits for free or reduced lunch and see if your income fits in one or the other category and you check which one. No tax return required, no one checks. It is your word. Then at mid term, 3% of those getting free/reduced lunch have a random computer drawing to "check" to see if income levels have changed. So, 3% are called with the question, "Has your income status changed since the first of the school year?" and if the answer is no, that ends the conversation. My area has very low unemployment but has very high free lunch. That tells you people are dishonest and want something free. That can be fixed. If everyone had to show their tax return, it would stop!!! it could be a job of about 3 people who approve free/reduced lunch taking the pressure off the schools to distribute the forms. There is a better way!!!!!

Florida is leading the way to a possible solution to the country’s supply-chain issues. Governor Ron DeSantis and the CEO of the Florida Ports Council Michael Rubin extended an invitation to those languishing ships to travel southeast and fill their ports—Florida is not only ready, but able to handle the off loading and the distribution of goods across the country.The WTVY report continues:So, Florida is putting out the word to shipping companies that ports in the Sunshine State are open and ready for business.“Florida is where your success comes in, and our seaports are the solution to ensure the cargo shipping log jam doesn’t become the Grinch that stole Christmas,” said Michael Rubin.Yet another example of DeSantis showing what leadership is through concrete action, rather than talking about what leadership should look like.

These stock markets are bending but all signs point to the markets breaking hard in the coming weeks. Lock in profits NOW is the best advice you will ever receive. Remember, its a lot more painful to stay in the markets through the ups and downs because if you go back 40 years and look at the best up days and the worst down days, the down days will destroy your up days, leaving you with big losses. You will make money in the long run by always staying in the markets but you will have a much smaller amount of money than if you get out and be patient when signs are pointing to a big break down in the markets. After you go back and check the past 40 years, one thing will be very obvious and that is the down days are much larger than the up days. That's just how markets work. Always have, always will.

Is Walmart a growth stock? Fast growth in a business is common to the early entry and success in a new market. Think Apple, Amazon, Microsoft, and even Walmart's early success at discount retail. Walmart's entry into ecommerce is such a opportunity and Walmart has proven it's approach is solid. CFO Brett Biggs said that this high-margin revenue stream “gives us flexibility to invest aggressively for the future”—in other words, the ability to go toe to toe with Amazon. E commerce is a lot bigger deal than it appears on the surface. Hugh revenue streams are involved in multiple connected areas. These revenue streams include ectomeres sales, Platform marketplace, digital advertising, digital payment apps, delivery solutions, and membership fees (included here is everything from music to special packages of apps delivering streaming tv.). So, the question is, How is Walmart addressing these opportunities and is Walmart a growth stock because of that? First ecommerce sales. Walmart's e-commerce sales to increase by 79% in fiscal 2021 after growing 37% in fiscal 2020. Second ecommerce platform. Walmart expects to reach $75 billion in global e-commerce sales by the end of 2021. Third Digital advertising. CEO Doug McMillon and CFO Brett Biggs said that retailer's ad business "nearly doubled" in the US during the company's Tuesday earnings call. They added that the number of advertisers running campaigns are up 175% over last year, while advertising-driven sales enjoyed a 95% spike. US digital advertising revenues on pace for $1.55 billion in 2021, up 53.5% for the year and representing 6.5% of US ecommerce channel ad spending Forth Digital payment apps, delivery(recent news) and membership fees may be address later or not? So, what is Walmart's intent ? CEO Doug McMillon recently said, “We weren’t the first place you go to buy products online. We’re trying to change that, obviously.”

Life is lived "always behind" or "always ahead". The most determining factor of what group you will be in "is" the cost of money. Don't pay twice for what you buy, if you want to be in the "always ahead" group. Walmart's new "Affirm" program could put you in the "always behind" group. Instead of layaway, Walmart is shifting to a program called “Affirm.” Billed as an alternative to layaway, Affirm allows people to purchase their items immediately and pay over time in a span of three to 24 months. The process requires customers to apply for a loan to pay for their items and while no late, prepayment or annual fees are charged, customers do pay interest ranging from 10% to 30%.
